Minute Entry for proceedings held before Magistrate Judge Gabriel W. Gorenstein: Arraignment (on S1-17-Cr-350) as to Avtandil Khurtsidze (27) Count 1,2 held on 6/8/2017. Plea entered by Avtandil Khurtsidze (27) Count 1,2 -- Not Guilty. (bw)
CJA 23 Financial Affidavit by (S1-17-Cr-350-27) Avtandil Khurtsidze. APPROVED: (Signed by Magistrate Judge Gabriel W. Gorenstein on 6/8/2017); Attorney Guy Oksendhendler. (bw)

Minute Entry on "Disposition Sheet" for proceedings held before Magistrate Judge Gabriel W. Gorenstein: Initial Appearance as to (S1-17-Cr-350-27) Avtandil Khurtsidze held on 6/8/2017. AUSA Andrew Adams. Defense Counsel Guy Oksenhendler (CJA). Georgian Interpreter needed. Proceeding: Rule 9. BAIL DISPOSITION: $200,000 PRB; 4 FRP; secured by $30,000 cash; travel restricted to SDNY/EDNY; surrender travel documents (& no new applications); strict pretrial supervision; Defendant to submit to urinalysis - if positive, add condition of drug testing/treatment; home detention; electronic monitoring. Defendant to be detained until all conditions are met. ADDITIONAL PROCEEDINGS: Defendant arraigned; pleads Not Guilty. Conference before District Judge on 6/9/2017 at 12 Noon. (bw)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Katherine B. Forrest:Pretrial Conference as to Zurab Dzhanashvili, Akaki Ubilava, Hamlet Uglava, Mikheil Toradze, Avtandil Kanadashvili, Nazo Gaprindashvili, Artur Vinokurov, Evgheni Melman, Zurab Buziashvili, Azer Arslanouk, Bakai Marat-Uulu, Andriy Petrushyn, Levan Makashvili, Semyon Saraidarov, Denys Davydov, Alex Mitselmakher, Yuriy Lerner, Avtandil Khurtsidze held on 6/9/2017. Defendant Zurab Dzhanashvili present with atty Amy Gallicchio. Defendant Akaki Ubilava present with atty Donna Newman. Defendant Hamlet Uglava present with atty Richard Ma. Defendant Mikheil Toradze present with atty Bobbi Sternheim. Defendant Avtandil Kanadashvili present with atty David Greenfield. Defendant Nazo Gaprindashvili present with atty Lance Lazzaro. Defendant Artur Vinokurov present with atty Gerald DiChiara. Defendant Evgheni Melman present with atty Donna Newman for Irving Cohen. Defendant Zurab Buziashvili present with atty Evan Prieston. Defendant Azer Arslanouk present with atty Louis Fasulo. Defendant Bakai Marat-Uulu present with atty Edward Waldron for John Burke. Defendant Andriy Petrushyn present with atty Arnold Levine. Defendant Levan Makashvili present with atty Xavier Donaldson. Defendant Denys Davydov present with atty Susan Kellmen. Defendant Alex Mitselmakher present with atty Andrew Frisch. Defendant Yuriy Lerner present with atty Charles Miller. Defendant Avtandil Khurtsidze present with atty Guy Oskenhendler. Court Reporter present. Russian and Georgian interpreters present. Conference held. Order to follow. Detention continued for defendants Zurab Dzhanashvili, Hamlet Uglava, Artur Vinokurov, Bakai Marat-Uulu, Andriy Petrushyn, Levan Makashvili, and, Avtandil Khurtsidze. Bail continued for the remaining defendants. (jp)

ORDER as to Zurab Dzhanashvili, Akaki Ubilava, Hamlet Uglava, Mikheil Toradze, Avtandil Kanadashvili, Nazo Gaprindashvili, Artur Vinokurov, Evgheni Melman, Zurab Buziashvili, Azer Arslanouk, Bakai Marat-Uulu, Andriy Petrushyn, Levan Makashvili, Semyon Saraidarov, Denys Davydov, Alex Mitselmakher, Yuriy Lerner, Avtandil Khurtsidze ( Discovery due by 7/24/2017., Status Conference set for 9/8/2017 at 11:00 AM before Judge Katherine B. Forrest.) Time excluded from 6/9/17 until 9/8/17. It is hereby ORDERED as follows: Discovery shall be produced on a rolling basis and provided to the defendants not later than 7/24/2017. The parties shall confer and submit to the Court a letter regarding any application to use a discovery coordinator in this action. The parties shall confer and submit to the Court a joint letter (if possible) regarding a schedule for motions. Such letter should be filed not later than 8/11/2017. The next status conference is scheduled for 9/8/2017, at 11:00 a.m. In advance of that conference, the parties should confer and be prepared to discuss a proposed trial date. In advance of the 9/8/2017 conference the Government shall advise the Court, in writing, that in the event multiple trials were to occur, which defendants should be tried together. Defendant Mikhel Toradzes conditions of bail are modified to include travel to the District of New Jersey, for employment purposes only. Defendant Akaki Ubilavas conditions of bail are modified to include travel, with prior notice to Pretrial Services and the Government, to upstate New York, for employment purposes only. Defendant Atvandil Kanadashvilis conditions of bail are modified to include travel to the District of New Jersey, for employment purposes only. Upon application of the Government and consented to by defendants, and as set forth on the record, time pursuant to 18 U.S.C. 3161 (h)(7)(A) of the Speedy Trial Act, is hereby excluded from 6/9/2017 to 9/8/2017. The Court finds the ends of justice are served by such an exclusion and that these ends outweigh the interests of the public and defendants in a speedy trial. SO ORDERED (Signed by Judge Katherine B. Forrest on 6/14/2017)(jw)

LETTER MOTION addressed to Judge Katherine B. Forrest from Andrew C. Adams dated 6/23/2017 re: Proposed Protective Order . Document filed by USA as to Razhden Shulaya, Zurab Dzhanashvili, Akaki Ubilava, Hamlet Uglava, Mamuka Chaganava, Mikheil Toradze, Avtandil Kanadashvili, Nazo Gaprindashvili, Artur Vinokurov, Evgheni Melman, Timur Suyunov, Zurab Buziashvili, Giorgi Lomishvili, Azer Arslanouk, Ivan Afanasyev, Denis Savgir, Bakai Marat-Uulu, Andriy Petrushyn, Diego Gabisonia, Levan Makashvili, Semyon Saraidarov, Vache Hovhannisyan, Denys Davydov, Erekle Kereselidze, Alex Mitselmakher, Yuriy Lerner, Avtandil Khurtsidze. (Attachments: # (1) Text of Proposed Order)(Adams, Andrew)

PROTECTIVE ORDER as to (17-Cr-350 & S1-17-Cr-350) Razhden Shulaya, Zurab Dzhanashvili, Akaki Ubilava, Hamlet Uglava, Mamuka Chaganava, Mikheil Toradze, Avtandil Kanadashvili, Nazo Gaprindashvili, Artur Vinokurov, Evgheni Melman, Timur Suyunov, Zurab Buziashvili, Giorgi Lomishvili, Azer Arslanouk, Ivan Afanasyev, Denis Savgir, Bakai Marat-Uulu, Andriy Petrushyn, Diego Gabisonia, Levan Makashvili, Semyon Saraidarov, Vache Hovhannisyan, Denys Davydov, Erekle Kereselidze, Alex Mitselmakher, Yuriy Lerner, Avtandil Khurtsidze. Upon the application of the United States of America, with the consent of the undersigned counsel, and the defendants having requested discovery under Fed. R. Crim. P. 16, the Court hereby finds and orders as follows: 1. Disclosure Material. The Government has made and will make disclosure to the defendants of documents, objects and information, including electronically stored information ("ESI"), pursuant to Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 16, 18 U.S.C. § 3500, and the Government's general obligation to produce exculpatory and impeachment material in criminal cases, all of which will be referred to herein as "disclosure material." The Government's disclosure material may include material that (i) affects the privacy, confidentiality and business interests of individuals and entities not named as parties in this case; (ii) would impede, if prematurely disclosed, the Government's ongoing investigation of uncharged individuals; (iii) would risk prejudicial pretrial publicity if publicly disseminated; and (iv) that is not authorized to be disclosed to the public or disclosed beyond that which is necessary for the defense of this criminal case. 2. Sensitive Disclosure Material. Certain of the Government's disclosure material, referred to herein as "sensitive disclosure material," contains information that identifies, or could lead to the identification of, witnesses who may be subject to intimidation or obstruction, and whose lives, persons, and property, as well as the lives, persons, and property of loved ones, will be subject to risk of harm absent the protective considerations set forth herein. The Government's designation of material as sensitive disclosure material will be controlling absent contrary order of the Court. 3. Good Cause. There is good cause for entry of the protective order set forth herein. Accordingly it is hereby Ordered: 4. Disclosure material shall not be disclosed by the defendants or each of his defense counsel, including any successor counsel ("the defense") other than as set forth herein, and shall be used by the defense solely for purposes of defending this action. The defense shall not post any disclosure material on any Internet site or network site to which persons other than the parties hereto have access, and shall not disclose any disclosure material to the media or any third party except as set forth below. 5. Disclosure material may be disclosed by counsel to:...[See this Protective Order]... Return or Destruction of Material: 12. Except for disclosure material that has been made part of the record of this case, the defense shall return to the Government or securely destroy or delete all disclosure material, including the seized ESI disclosure material, within 30 days of the expiration of the period for direct appeal from any verdict in the above-captioned case; the period of direct appeal from any order dismissing any of the charges in the above-captioned case; or the granting of any motion made on behalf of the Government dismissing any charges in the above-captioned case, whichever date is later. Retention of Jurisdiction: 13. The provisions of this order shall not terminate at the conclusion of this prosecution and the Court will retain jurisdiction to enforce this Order following termination of the case. SO ORDERED: (Signed by Judge Katherine B. Forrest on 6/27/2017)(bw)

ORDER as to Razhden Shulaya, Zurab Dzhanashvili, Akaki Ubilava, Hamlet Uglava, Mamuka Chaganava, Mikheil Toradze, Avtandil Kanadashvili, Nazo Gaprindashvili, Artur Vinokurov, Evgheni Melman, Timur Suyunov, Zurab Buziashvili, Giorgi Lomishvili, Azer Arslanouk, Ivan Afanasyev, Denis Savgir, Bakai Marat-Uulu, Andriy Petrushyn, Diego Gabisonia, Levan Makashvili, Semyon Saraidarov, Vache Hovhannisyan, Denys Davydov, Erekle Kereselidze, Alex Mitselmakher, Yuriy Lerner, Avtandil Khurtsidze, Nikoloz Jikia. Several of the defendants in this action have been granted bail and are on pretrial release. The Court Sua Sponte modifies the conditions of release for those defendants to include that any failed or missed drug test shall constitute a violation of the terms of pretrial release. Those defendants will be subjected to possible bail revocation. SO ORDERED.. (Signed by Judge Katherine B. Forrest on 8/2/2017)(ft)

ORDER as to Razhden Shulaya, Zurab Dzhanashvili, Akaki Ubilava, Hamlet Uglava, Mamuka Chaganava, Mikheil Toradze, Avtandil Kanadashvili, Nazo Gaprindashvili, Artur Vinokurov, Evgheni Melman, Timur Suyunov, Zurab Buziashvili, Giorgi Lomishvili, Azer Arslanouk, Ivan Afanasyev, Denis Savgir, Bakai Marat-Uulu, Andriy Petrushyn, Diego Gabisonia, Levan Makashvili, Semyon Saraidarov, Vache Hovhannisyan, Denys Davydov, Erekle Kereselidze, Alex Mitselmakher, Yuriy Lerner, Avtandil Khurtsidze, Nikoloz Jikia. In light of the Governments letter, dated August 11, 2017 (ECF no. 232) which proposes groupings of the defendants for trials in this case, the Court hereby adjusts the schedule as follows: The status conference currently scheduled for September 8, 2017, at 11:00 a.m. will be for Group A which includes: Razhden Shulaya, Nazo Gaprindashvili, Avtandil Khurtsidze, and Azer Arslanouk. A status conference for Group B which includes: Zurab Dzhanashvili, Zurab Buziashvili, Semyon Saraidarov, Erekle Kereselidze, and Yuriy Lerner, is scheduled for September 8, 2017, at 12:00 p.m. A status conference for Group C which includes: Bakai Marat-Uulu, Nikoloz Jikia, Giorgi Lomishvili, and Andriy Petrushyn, is scheduled for September 12, 2017, at 1:00 p.m. A status conference for Group D which includes: Mamuka Chaganava, Mikheil Toradze, Artur Vinokurov, and Avtandil Kanadashvili, is scheduled for September 13, 2017, at 1:00 p.m. A status conference for Group E which includes: Evgheni Melman, Akaki Ubilava, Levan Makashvili, Hamlet Uglava, and Diego Gabisonia, is scheduled for September 15, 2017, at 2:00 p.m. The Court also intends to try the cases back to back. At the above conferences, the parties should be prepared to discuss trial dates, with the first trial to begin not later than June 4, 2018. The Court proposes the following schedule: Group A: June 4, 2018 through June 29, 2018 Group B: July 9, 2018 through August 3, 2018 Group C: August 27, 2018 through September 7, 2018 Group D: September 17, 2017 through September 28, 2018 Group E: October 8, 20148 through October 26, 2018 SO ORDERED. (Signed by Judge Katherine B. Forrest on 8/16/2017)(ft)

AMENDED ORDER as to Razhden Shulaya, Zurab Dzhanashvili, Akaki Ubilava, Hamlet Uglava, Mamuka Chaganava, Mikheil Toradze, Avtandil Kanadashvili, Nazo Gaprindashvili, Artur Vinokurov, Evgheni Melman, Timur Suyunov, Zurab Buziashvili, Giorgi Lomishvili, Azer Arslanouk, Ivan Afanasyev, Denis Savgir, Bakai Marat-Uulu, Andriy Petrushyn, Diego Gabisonia, Levan Makashvili, Semyon Saraidarov, Vache Hovhannisyan, Denys Davydov, Erekle Kereselidze, Alex Mitselmakher, Yuriy Lerner, Avtandil Khurtsidze, Nikoloz Jikia. The status conference currently scheduled for September 8, 2017, at 11:00 a.m. will be for "Group A" which includes: Razhden Shulaya, Nazo Gaprindashvili, Avtandil Khurtsidze, and Azer Arslanouk. A status conference for Group B which includes: Zurab Dzhanashvili, Zurab Buziashvili, Semyon Saraidarov, Erekle Kereselidze, and Yuriy Lerner, is scheduled for September 8, 2017, at 12:00 p.m. A status conference for "Group C" which includes: Bakai Marat-Uulu, Nikoloz Jikia, Giorgi Lomishvili, and Andriy Petrushyn, is scheduled for September 12, 2017, at 1:00 p.m. A status conference for Group D which includes: Mamuka Chaganava, Mikheil Toradze, Artur Vinokurov, and Avtandil Kanadashvili, is scheduled for September 13, 2017, at 1:00 p.m. A status conference for "Group E" which includes: Evgheni Melman, Akaki Ubilava, Levan Makashvili, Hamlet Uglava, and Diego Gabisonia, is scheduled for September 15, 2017, at 2:00 p.m. A status conference for "Group F" which includes: Vache Hovhannisyan, Ivan Afanasyev, Denys Davidov, Alex Mitselmakher, Denis Savgir, and Timur Suyunov, is scheduled for September 19, 2017, at 1:00 p.m. The Court also intends to try the cases back to back. At the above conferences, the parties should be prepared to discuss trial dates, with the first trial to begin not later than June 4, 2018. The Court proposes the following schedule: Group A: June 4, 2018 through June 29, 2018 Group B: July 9, 2018 through August 3, 2018. Group C: August 27, 2018 through September 7, 2018. Group D: September 17, 2017 through September 28, 2018. Group E: October 8, 20148 through October 26, 2018. Group F: November 5, 20148 through November 16, 2018. SO ORDERED. (Signed by Judge Katherine B. Forrest on 8/21/2017)(ft)

LETTER MOTION addressed to Judge Katherine B. Forrest from Guy Oksenhendler dated Sept 8, 2017 re: To Withdraw as Counsel and To Not Appear for Conference is Light of Retained Counsel . Document filed by Avtandil Khurtsidze. (Oksenhendler, Guy)

MEMO ENDORSEMENT granting [279] LETTER MOTION filed by Avtandil Khurtsidze (27), addressed to Judge Katherine B. Forrest from Attorney Guy Oksenhendler dated Sept 8, 2017 re: To Withdraw as Counsel and To Not Appear for Conference is Light of Retained Counsel. Counsel has been contacted by new counsel for the defendant and respectfully requests to withdraw as appointed counsel in light of the defendant retaining private counsel. Although no Substitution of Counsel has been filed, it is requested that Counsel be allowed to withdraw and not appear today for the formality of being substituted as counsel. ENDORSEMENT: SO ORDERED. (Signed by Judge Katherine B. Forrest on 9/8/2017) (bw)

AMENDED ORDER as to Razhden Shulaya, Zurab Dzhanashvili, Akaki Ubilava, Hamlet Uglava, Mamuka Chaganava, Mikheil Toradze, Avtandil Kanadashvili, Nazo Gaprindashvili, Artur Vinokurov, Evgheni Melman, Timur Suyunov, Zurab Buziashvili, Giorgi Lomishvili, Azer Arslanouk, Ivan Afanasyev, Denis Savgir, Bakai Marat-Uulu, Andriy Petrushyn, Diego Gabisonia, Levan Makashvili, Semyon Saraidarov, Vache Hovhannisyan, Denys Davydov, Erekle Kereselidze, Alex Mitselmakher, Yuriy Lerner, Avtandil Khurtsidze, Nikoloz Jikia: In light of the Governments letter, dated August 11, 2017 (ECF no. 232) which proposes groupings of the defendants for trials in this case, the Court hereby adjusts the schedule as follows: • The status conference currently scheduled for September 8, 2017, at 11:00 a.m. will be for "Group A" which includes: Razhden Shulaya, Nazo Gaprindashvili, Avtandil Khurtsidze, and Azer Arslanouk.• A status conference for "Group B" which includes: Zurab Dzhanashvili, Zurab Buziashvili, Semyon Saraidarov, Erekle Kereselidze, and Yuriy Lerner, is scheduled for September 8, 2017, at 12:00 p.m. • A status conference for "Group C" which includes: Bakai Marat-Uulu, Nikoloz Jikia, Giorgi Lomishvili, and Andriy Petrushyn, is scheduled for September 12, 2017, at 1:00 p.m. • A status conference for "Group D" which includes: Mamuka Chaganava, Mikheil Toradze, Artur Vinokurov, and Avtandil Kanadashvili, is scheduled for September 13, 2017, at 1:00 p.m. • A status conference for "Group E" which includes: Evgheni Melman, Akaki Ubilava, Levan Makashvili, Hamlet Uglava, and Diego Gabisonia, is scheduled for September 15, 2017, at 2:00 p.m. • A status conference for "Group F" which includes: Vache Hovhannisyan, Ivan Afanasyev, Denys Davidov, Alex Mitselmakher, Denis Savgir, and Timur Suyunov, is scheduled for September 19, 2017, at 1:00 p.m. The Court also intends to try the cases back to back. At the above conferences, the parties should be prepared to discuss trial dates, with the first trial to begin not later than June 4, 2018. The Court proposes the following schedule: • Group A: June 4, 2018 through June 29, 2018 • Group B: July 9, 2018 through August 3, 2018 • Group C: August 27, 2018 through September 7, 2018• Group D: September 17, 2018 through September 28, 2018• Group E: October 8, 2018 through October 26, 2018• Group F: November 5, 2018 through November 16, 2018 SO ORDERED. (Signed by Judge Katherine B. Forrest on 9/11/2017) (lnl)

ORDER as to Razhden Shulaya (1), Nazo Gaprindashvili (8), Azer Arslanouk (14), Avtandil Khurtsidze (27). Pursuant to a proceeding with the Court on 9/8/2017, it is hereby ORDERED as follows: -As set forth on the record, Guy Oksenhendler is relieved as counsel for defendant Avtandil Khurtsidze, and Farrukh Nuridinov has been retained as counsel of record for the defendant. -Motions are to be filed not later than 11/17/2017. Responses are to be filed not later than 12/1/2017. Replies, if any, are to be filed not later than 12/8/2017. If the Court determines that a hearing is necessary, it will promptly inform the parties. -The next status conference is scheduled for 12/8/2017, at 11:00 a.m. In advance of that conference, if the parties believe that a conference is not necessary, they should submit a letter to the Court and the conference will be adjourned. -Trial shall commence on 6/4/2018, at 9:00 a.m. -As set forth on the record, and consented to by defendants, time pursuant to 18 U.S.C. 3161 (h)(7)(A) of the Speedy Trial Act, is hereby excluded from 9/8/2017 to 12/8/2017. The Court finds the ends of justice are served by such an exclusion and that these ends outweigh the interests of the public and defendants in a speedy trial. SO ORDERED: (Signed by Judge Katherine B. Forrest on 9/12/2017)(bw)

LETTER MOTION addressed to Judge Katherine B. Forrest from Andrew C. Adams dated 9/28/2017 re: Request for Curcio Inquiries . Document filed by USA as to Andriy Petrushyn, Avtandil Khurtsidze. (Attachments: # (1) Exhibit Ex. A to Curcio Letter, # (2) Exhibit Ex. B to Curcio Letter)(Adams, Andrew)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Katherine B. Forrest:Hearing as to Avtandil Khurtsidze held on 10/10/2017. Defendant present with attorneys Farrukh Nuridinov and Yuliya Vangorodska. AUSA Andrew Adams present. CJA counsel Jonathan Bach and CHristina Dolling present. Court Reporter present. Georgian Interpreter present. Hearing held. Order to follow. Detention continued. (jp)

ORDER as to Avtandil Khurtsidze. On October 10, 2017, at the request of the Government, the Court held a hearing with respect to issues that may pertain to defendant Avtandil Khurtsidze. After hearing from all parties and special Curcio counsel, the Court determined that further briefing is appropriate. Not later than October 24, 2017, counsel for the defendant shall file their letter brief(s) as set forth on the record. The Government shall respond not later than October 31, 2017. The next conference is scheduled for 11/20/2017, at 1:00 p.m. Prior to that time, Jonathan Bach (Curcio counsel) shall meet with the defendant to review the submissions. SO ORDERED. (Status Conference set for 11/20/2017 at 01:00 PM before Judge Katherine B. Forrest.) (Signed by Judge Katherine B. Forrest on 10/11/2017)(ft)
